Message.Title: Buried deep in 10-Q: Skyrocketing Tegra losses
Message.Msg: - Buried deep in 10-Q: Skyrocketing Tegra losses. Remember when Jen and his Interim CFO announced their 2Q “earnings” a few weeks ago? But didn’t give too many details about the CPB/Tegra Division. Well, the 10-Q for nvidia’s 2Q was filed on Wednesday with the SEC. Along with all the sordid details that weren’t previously mentioned. Let’s take a look at the CPB/Tegra Division’s results, shall we? First, the results are Buried about as deep as can possibly be. At the bottom of page 28 of the FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (UNAUDITED) section. Here’s the link. Scroll down to page 28. I’ll wait for ya. http://yahoo.brand.edgar-online.com/displayfilinginfo.aspx?FilingID=8787648-7921-101340&type=sect&dcn=0001045810-12-000036 Note that the nvidia Consumer Products Business, or CPB, “is comprised of Tegra based smartphone and tablet products," as well as this and that. But realistically, Icera revenues and the rest of this and that are a rounding error. It’s almost all Tegra. So how exactly did the CPB/Tegra Division do? Well, put on a gas mask and let’s take a look at the 10-Q filed with the SEC on 8/22/2012. All numbers in ($000’s) CPB REVENUE – 2Q year-to-year 179,646 __ Three months ended July 29, 2012 167,684 __ Three months ended July 31, 2011 --------- +11,962 < A little bit more revenue, right boys? + 7.13% < That’s it for CPB/Tegra growth? 7.13% year-over-year? CPB OPERATING INCOME (LOSS) – 2Q year-to-year (89,732) __ Three months ended July 29, 2012 (35,541) __ Three months ended July 31, 2011 ---------- (54,191) < Increased CPB/Tegra Loss from the prior year +152.47% < Growth in CPB/Tegra Losses vs. 7.13% growth in revenue. Or another way to look at is, on an incremental increase of $11,962,000 in sales, the CPB/Tegra division lost ($54,191,000) CPB MARGINS – 2Q year-to-year (-49.95%) __ Three months ended July 29, 2012 (-21.19%) __ Three months ended July 31, 2011 The only thing Worse than negative margins – is Rapidly Growing negative margins. Unscrew your gas mask canisters -- and reload, boys. Next we’ll take a look at the six months year-to-date CPB results. CPB REVENUE – First Half -- year-to-year 312,158 __ Six months ended July 29, 2012 290,294 __ Six months ended July 31, 2011 --------- + 21,875 + 7.53% < That’s it boys. All that Tegra carnival barking for a measly +7.53% growth. CPB OPERATING INCOME (LOSS) -- First Half -- year-to-year (191,641) __ Six months ended July 29, 2012 ( 70,846) __ Six months ended July 31, 2011 ----------- (120,795) < Even more Lost this year than last year, right boys? + 170.50% < An impressive percentage -- but unfortunately in Operating Losses The CPB/Tegra Division is on pace to rack-up nearly $400,000,000.00 of losses this year alone. CPB MARGINS -- First Half -- year-to-year (-61.39%) __ Six months ended July 29, 2012 (-24.40%) __ Six months ended July 31, 2011 Imagine losing $161.39 on every $100.00 sale? That’s exactly what Jen’s CPB /Tegra business is doing. Selling Tegra’s WELL below their cost. And the funny thing is – the pumper boys cheer every time the Tegra has a “win”! When they should be mourning the loss of even more cash. Oh my! My my my. Operating Losses absolutely Skyrocketed. Yes. SKYROCKETED, boys. ($191,641,000.00) just for the six months ended July 29, 2012. Up from ($70,846,000.00) lost in the same year ago period. Might explain why Jen and his Interim CFO didn’t go into too much CPB/Tegra detail on the conference call, right boys? What’s Best always say again? Hummm? "The first ones out get the best and highest prices." -

Topic.Title: Qualcomm Confirms Quad-Core Snapdragon S4 will be in LG Optimus G

Message.Msg: The S4 family: 1)S4 Dual core stand alone no integrated Lte 2)S4 Dual core integrated Lte 3) The latest S4 Pro with a huge GPU that missed the mark for WinRT and no integrated LTE -(the one designed for the WinRT but DX11 was an after thought so they have to redesign to take out the Adreno 320 and replace that with the Power VR cores - not out yet. This part is more suited for android tablets with 1920x1200 resolution. WinRT DX11 firmware mode drivers are stucked and it's almost pointless for a WinRT manufacturer to do this - as soon as they go into production the PowerVR version may be sampling and/or Nvidia would have come out with a better CPU/GPU at a better price! So in a word the S4 Pro is an ORPHAN and mainly for Phone manufacturers looking to prove their manhood. It's like putting the A5X into the iPhone 5 - makes no sense - you need the CPU performance not the bloated GPU since you are not driving a 1920 x 1200 screen. The GPU sucks more juice then the CPU so it's a solution looking for a problem.

Topic.Title: Qualcomm APQ8064 Benchmarked in GLBenchmark 2.5

Message.Msg: Don't think T3+ is in a launched product yet. S4 Pro is an orphaned product - WinRt could have appreciated it's CPU performance BUT they screwed up. It was targeted for WinRT - what a big fiasco. So now it's looking for homes in Cell Phones and miscellaneous parts where they can sell for $500+.
